Create a Blog Module

Create a Table called `Posts`

CREATE TABLE `posts` (
  `id` int(11) NOT NULL,
  `post_author` varchar(255) NOT NULL,
  `post_title` varchar(255) NOT NULL,
  `post_body` text NOT NULL,
  `post_modified_at` int(11) NOT NULL,
  `post_created_at` int(11) NOT NULL,
  `post_slug` varchar(255) NOT NULL
) ENGINE=InnoDB DEFAULT CHARSET=latin1;

ALTER TABLE `posts`
  ADD PRIMARY KEY (`id`);

ALTER TABLE `posts`
  MODIFY `id` int(11) NOT NULL AUTO_INCREMENT, AUTO_INCREMENT=13;
COMMIT;

Then, in routes.php add this:

// application\config\routes.php
$route['blog']                 = 'Blog/index';
$route['blog/post/(:any)']     = 'Blog/post/$1';

Blog.php

<?php
  // application\modules\Blog\controllers\Blog.php
  defined('KISSPATH') OR exit('Direct script access not allowed');
?>
class Blog extends KISS_Controller
{

  public function __construct()
  {
    parent::__construct();
    $this->load->model('Blog_model');
    $this->model = $this->Blog_model;
  }

  public function index()
  {
    $data['posts'] = $this->model->get_posts();
    $data['page_title'] = 'Blog';
    $this->load->view('templates/header',$data);
    $this->load->view('posts', $data);
    $this->load->view('templates/footer',$data);
  }


  public function post( $slug )
  {
    $data['post'] = $this->model->get_post( $slug );
    $data['page_title'] = 'Blog | ' . $data['post']['post_title'];
    $this->load->view('templates/header',$data);
    $this->load->view('post', $data);
    $this->load->view('templates/footer',$data);
  }

}

Blog_model.php

<?php
  // application\modules\Blog\models\Blog_model.php
  defined('KISSPATH') OR exit('Direct script access not allowed');
?>
class Blog_model extends KISS_Model
{
  public function __construct()
  {
    parent::__construct();
    $this->table = "posts";
  }

  public function get_posts()
  {
    return $this->db->query("SELECT * FROM $this->table ORDER BY post_created_at DESC");
  }

  public function get_post( $slug )
  {
    $this->db->query("SELECT * FROM $this->table WHERE post_slug = '$slug' ORDER BY post_created_at DESC");
    return $this->db->row_array();
  }

}

post.php — Single Post View

<?php
  // application\modules\Blog\views\blog\post.php
  defined('KISSPATH') OR exit('Direct script access not allowed');
?>

<h2><?php echo $post['post_title']; ?></h2>
<date><?php echo date('F jS, Y',$post['post_created_at']); ?></date>
<p><?php echo $post['post_body']; ?></p>

posts.php — Blog Feed

<?php
  // application\modules\Blog\views\blog\posts.php
  defined('KISSPATH') OR exit('Direct script access not allowed');
?>

<?php foreach( $posts as $post ) : ?>

<h2><a href="<?php echo base_url("blog/post/$post[post_slug]"); ?>"><?php echo $post['post_title']; ?></a></h2>
<date><?php echo date('F jS, Y',$post['post_created_at']); ?></date>
<p><?php echo $post['post_body']; ?></p>
<hr>

<?php endforeach; ?>
Create a Page Module/Controller
<?php
  // application\controllers\Pages.php — OR — application\modules\Pages\controllers\Pages.php (for a module)
  defined('KISSPATH') OR exit('Direct script access not allowed');
?>
class Pages extends KISS_Controller
{

  public function __construct()
  {
    parent::__construct();
  }

  public function index( $page = 'home' ) // Don't forget to create a view file called 'home'!
  {
    $data['page_title'] = ucfirst($page) . ' page | YOUR_WEBSITE';
    $this->load->view($page, $data);
  }

}

Then, set your routes.php file to this:

// application\config\routes.php
$route['default_controller']   = 'Pages/index';
$route['(:any)']               = 'Pages/index/$1';

OPTIONAL: You could also create a Pages module by simply creating a Pages folder in the Modules folder that contains 3 folders (controllers, models, views) and in the views folder create a folder called pages to store all your view files.

Create a Template Module

Create a folder called Templates in the Modules folder, including 3 folders (controllers, models, views). In your Controllers folder create a file (shown below) called Templates.php. Then, in your View folder, create a folder called templates to put all the view files and folders in. Next, Create a file called dashboard_view.php in the templates folder. (Optional): Create a folder in your templates folder called dashboard and inside that create a header.php and footer.php file and put dashboard_view.php in there as well.

Create a folder called Dashboard in the Modules folder, including 3 folders (controllers, models, views). In your Controllers folder create a file (shown below) called Dashboard.php. Create another file in your Views folder called dashboard.php.

Templates.php

<?php
  // application\modules\Templates\controllers\Templates.php
  defined('KISSPATH') OR exit('Direct script access not allowed');
?>
class Templates extends KISS_Controller
{
  public function __construct()
  {
    parent::__construct();
  }

  public function dashboard($data)
  {
    $this->load->view('dashboard/dashboard_view',$data);
  }

}

header.php

// application\modules\Templates\views\templates\dashboard\header.php
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html lang='en'>
  <head>
    <title><?php echo $page_title; ?></title>
  </head>
  <body>

footer.php

// application\modules\Templates\views\templates\dashboard\footer.php
    <footer>© Copyright <?php echo date('Y'); ?></footer>
  </body>
</html>

dashboard_view.php

// application\modules\Templates\views\templates\dashboard\dashboard_view.php
<?php $this->load->view('dashboard/header',$data); ?>
<?php $this->load->view($view_file,$data); ?>
<?php $this->load->view('dashboard/footer',$data); ?>

Dashboard.php

// application\modules\Dashboard\controllers\Dashboard.php
class Dashboard extends KISS_Controller
{
  public function __construct()
  {
    parent::__construct();
  }

  public function index()
  {
    $data['page_title'] = 'Dashboard Template';
    $data['view_file'] = 'dashboard';
    $this->load->module('Templates/dashboard',$data);
  }
}

dashboard.php

// application\modules\Dashboard\views\dashboard.php
<h2>This is the Dashboard module view</h2>
RESULT
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html lang='en'>
  <head>
    <title>Dashboard Template</title>
  </head>
  <body>

    <h2>This is the Dashboard module view</h2>

  </body>
</html>
